text: [Music]
I am a former Chief Information officer
for the health for a healthc care
organization that managed emergency
departments across the country and we
really leveraged cloud-based Services
over a 10year period of time to have
about 300% growth in revenue and to be
able to expand our service line by a
five-fold what's driving it leaders to
embrace cloud services is really the
pace of innovation that they're able to
bring into their organization that
ability to be able to scale their
operations and that opportunity to over
time decrease cost so it all goes back
to decreasing the complexity increasing
the agility within the organization a
key thing that we have to remember and
reflect on is from Albert Einstein
today's problems cannot be solved if we
still think the way that we thought when
we created them when we first began our
businesses we had high agility and low
costs and low complexity as we added
products and service lines and people
and and went from small businesses to
midsize businesses to really large
Enterprises what happened was we created
complexity in our systems and this
resulted in a decrease in the agility of
our organization and we see the pace by
which cloud is delivering Innovation and
the pace by which it's delivering new
features and functionality gives us that
ability to apply that to really deliver
value that helps our organization become
a better company so where we have an
opportunity today is to take this term
cloud and cloud computing and transition
that into a leadership conversation so
that we as it leaders and Executives in
the organization can say what is
information technology role and how do
we leverage Cloud to better align how
technology is delivered to meet those
primary business
objectives but because we're such a
large organization and Enterprises that
it takes a while for all those things to
come into effect so as as we're starting
to look at what 2020 looks like in our
vision we need to start that Journey
today
[Music]
